other_tests.findings: The gallbladder is moderately distended with mild edema within the gallbladder wall and minimal pericholecystic stranding of fat. Layering sludge versus stones are seen within the gallbladder fundus. The pancreatic duct appears normal in morphology. The pancreatic parenchyma enhances homogeneously with no focal lesions. No intra or extrahepatic biliary ductal dilation. A 2 cm right renal lower pole cortical cyst demonstrates presence of a thin enhancing internal septation.
other_tests.changes_over_time: A six-month follow-up ultrasound is recommended to reevaluate stability and any change in internal morphology of the renal cyst.
